diseases.name: Covid-19
diseases.causes: Infection with SARS-CoV-2 virus
diseases.treatment: Vaccination, antiviral medications (e.g., Remdesivir), supportive care
diseases.cure: No definitive cure, but vaccines and treatments reduce severity
diseases.prevention: Vaccination, wearing a mask, social distancing, hand hygiene

diseases.name: Influenza (flu)
diseases.causes: Infection with influenza virus
diseases.prevention: Vaccination, hand hygiene, avoiding close contact with sick individuals
diseases.treatment: Vaccination, antiviral drugs (e.g., Tamiflu), rest, and hydration
diseases.cure: No cure, but symptoms usually resolve on their own; vaccines prevent severe cases

diseases.name: Arthritis
diseases.causes: Inflammation of joints, often due to autoimmune disorders or wear and tear
diseases.prevention: Healthy weight management, regular exercise, avoiding joint strain
diseases.treatment: Pain relief medications, anti-inflammatory drugs, physical therapy, surgery in some cases
diseases.cure: No cure, but symptoms can be managed with medications and therapy

diseases.name: Chronic kidney disease
diseases.causes: Damage to the kidneys, often due to diabetes, high blood pressure, or other underlying conditions
diseases.prevention: Managing underlying conditions, maintaining a healthy lifestyle, regular checkups
diseases.treatment: Dialysis, medications to control blood pressure, kidney transplant
diseases.cure: No cure, but manageable with treatment; transplant is an option for some

diseases.name: Alzheimer's disease
diseases.causes: Unknown, but likely involves a combination of genetic, environmental, and lifestyle factors
diseases.prevention: Healthy lifestyle, cognitive stimulation, social engagement
diseases.treatment: Medications to manage symptoms, supportive care
diseases.cure: No cure, but treatments can slow progression and manage symptoms

diseases.name: Tuberculosis
diseases.causes: Infection with Mycobacterium tuberculosis bacteria
diseases.cure: Curable with proper treatment over several months
diseases.prevention: Vaccination (BCG vaccine), avoiding close contact with infected individuals

diseases.name: Diabetes type 2
diseases.causes: Body's inability to use insulin properly
diseases.treatment: Lifestyle changes, blood sugar monitoring, medication (e.g., Metformin), insulin therapy
diseases.cure: No cure, but manageable through medication and lifestyle changes
diseases.prevention: Healthy diet, regular physical activity, maintaining a healthy weight

diseases.name: Asthma
diseases.causes: Inflammation and narrowing of airways due to environmental triggers (e.g., pollen, dust) or genetic factors
diseases.treatment: Inhalers (bronchodilators, corticosteroids), avoiding triggers, oral medications
diseases.cure: No cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: Avoiding allergens, regular use of controller medications

diseases.name: Hypertension (high blood pressure)
diseases.causes: Various factors including poor diet, lack of physical activity, genetics, and stress
diseases.treatment: Lifestyle changes (healthy diet, exercise), blood pressure-lowering medications (e.g., ACE inhibitors, diuretics)
diseases.cure: No cure, but controllable with treatment
diseases.prevention: Healthy lifestyle, regular physical activity, low sodium intake

diseases.name: Migraine
diseases.causes: Genetic and environmental factors, hormonal changes, stress, lack of sleep, certain foods or drinks
diseases.treatment: Pain relief medications (e.g., triptans, NSAIDs), preventive medications (e.g., beta-blockers), lifestyle changes
diseases.cure: No cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: Avoiding known triggers, regular sleep schedule, stress management

diseases.name: Parkinson's disease
diseases.causes: Loss of dopamine-producing brain cells, likely due to a combination of genetic and environmental factors
diseases.treatment: Medications to improve motor symptoms (e.g., Levodopa), physical therapy, deep brain stimulation
diseases.cure: No cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: No known prevention, but healthy lifestyle may help reduce risk

diseases.name: Hepatitis b
diseases.causes: Infection with the Hepatitis B virus
diseases.treatment: Antiviral medications, liver transplantation in severe cases
diseases.cure: No definitive cure, but treatment can reduce symptoms and liver damage
diseases.prevention: Vaccination, avoiding contact with infected blood or bodily fluids

diseases.name: Multiple sclerosis (ms)
diseases.causes: Autoimmune attack on the central nervous system
diseases.treatment: Medications to slow progression (e.g., corticosteroids, immunotherapy), physical therapy
diseases.cure: No cure, but symptoms can be managed

diseases.name: Celiac disease
diseases.causes: Immune reaction to gluten
diseases.cure: No cure, but symptoms can be managed with a gluten-free diet

diseases.name: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (copd)
diseases.causes: Long-term exposure to irritants like tobacco smoke, air pollution
diseases.cure: No cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: Avoid smoking, reduce exposure to lung irritants

diseases.name: Liver cirrhosis
diseases.causes: Chronic liver damage, often due to alcohol abuse or hepatitis
diseases.treatment: Lifestyle changes, medications, liver transplant in severe cases
diseases.cure: No cure, but progression can be slowed

diseases.name: Lyme disease
diseases.causes: Bacteria transmitted through tick bites
diseases.cure: Curable with early antibiotic treatment
diseases.prevention: Avoid tick bites, use tick repellents

diseases.name: Aids
diseases.causes: Infection with the Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)
diseases.cure: No cure, but ART can control the virus
diseases.prevention: Safe sex practices, avoiding sharing needles

diseases.name: Irritable bowel syndrome (ibs)
diseases.causes: Exact cause unknown, but related to gut-brain interactions
diseases.treatment: Dietary changes, medications for symptom relief
diseases.cure: No cure, but symptoms can be managed

diseases.name: Ebola virus disease
diseases.causes: Infection with Ebola virus
diseases.cure: No definitive cure, but treatments can improve survival
diseases.prevention: Avoiding contact with infected individuals and animals

diseases.name: Chikungunya
diseases.causes: Virus transmitted by mosquito bites
diseases.cure: No cure, but symptoms resolve over time

diseases.name: Epilepsy
diseases.causes: Abnormal brain activity, can be genetic or due to injury
diseases.treatment: Anti-seizure medications, surgery in some cases
diseases.cure: No cure, but seizures can be controlled
diseases.prevention: No definitive prevention, but managing triggers helps

diseases.name: Dengue fever
diseases.causes: virus transmitted by mosquito bites
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms usually resolve

diseases.name: Crohn's disease
diseases.causes: inflammation of the digestive tract, possibly autoimmune
diseases.treatment: anti-inflammatory medications, surgery in severe cases
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: no definitive prevention, but a healthy lifestyle may reduce risk

diseases.name: Rheumatoid arthritis
diseases.causes: immune system attacks joint tissues
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed with treatment
diseases.prevention: no known prevention, but managing risk factors helps

diseases.name: Ulcerative colitis
diseases.causes: inflammation of the colon and rectum, possibly autoimmune
diseases.treatment: anti-inflammatory drugs, immunosuppressants, surgery in severe cases
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: no definitive prevention, but a healthy lifestyle may reduce risk

diseases.name: Psoriasis
symptoms: red patches of skin with silvery scales
diseases.causes: immune system triggers rapid skin cell production
diseases.cure: no cure, but treatment can manage flare-ups
diseases.prevention: no known prevention, but managing stress and triggers helps

diseases.name: Sleep apnea
symptoms: episodes of stopped breathing during sleep
diseases.causes: blocked airways during sleep, often due to obesity or structural issues
diseases.treatment: continuous positive airway pressure (cpap), weight loss, surgery
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: maintaining a healthy weight, avoiding alcohol before bedtime

diseases.name: Vertigo
diseases.causes: inner ear problems or brain conditions
diseases.treatment: vestibular rehabilitation, medications, surgery in some cases
diseases.cure: treatment depends on the cause, but some cases resolve over time
diseases.prevention: managing risk factors like infections or injuries

diseases.name: Hypertension
diseases.causes: high blood pressure due to various factors such as genetics, poor diet, or lack of exercise
diseases.cure: no cure, but can be managed with treatment
diseases.prevention: healthy diet, regular exercise, stress management

diseases.name: Eczema
diseases.causes: overactive immune response often triggered by allergens or irritants
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: avoiding known triggers, keeping skin moisturized

diseases.name: Migraine
diseases.causes: genetic and environmental factors, stress, certain foods or medications
diseases.treatment: pain relievers, anti-nausea medications, lifestyle changes
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed

diseases.name: Osteoporosis
diseases.causes: weakening of bones due to aging, hormonal changes, or calcium deficiency
diseases.treatment: medications to strengthen bones, calcium and vitamin d supplements
diseases.cure: no cure, but progression can be slowed
diseases.prevention: regular exercise, adequate intake of calcium and vitamin d

diseases.name: Celiac disease
diseases.causes: immune reaction to consuming gluten
diseases.cure: no cure, but a strict gluten-free diet can manage symptoms
diseases.prevention: no known prevention, but early diagnosis helps

diseases.name: Anemia
diseases.causes: lack of healthy red blood cells, often due to iron deficiency
diseases.treatment: iron supplements, dietary changes, treatment of underlying cause
diseases.cure: curable in some cases, depending on the cause

diseases.name: Gallstones
symptoms: pain in the upper right abdomen
diseases.causes: buildup of cholesterol or bilirubin in the gallbladder
diseases.treatment: surgical removal of the gallbladder, medications to dissolve stones
diseases.cure: curable with surgery
diseases.prevention: maintaining a healthy diet and weight

diseases.name: Fibromyalgia
diseases.causes: unknown, but likely related to genetics, infections, or trauma
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: no known prevention, but stress management helps

diseases.name: Irritable bowel syndrome (ibs)
diseases.causes: unknown, but triggers include stress and certain foods
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: managing stress and avoiding trigger foods

diseases.name: Bronchitis
diseases.causes: viral or bacterial infection, exposure to irritants like tobacco smoke
diseases.treatment: rest, fluids, cough medicine, in some cases antibiotics
diseases.cure: acute cases are curable, chronic cases are managed
diseases.prevention: avoid smoking, get vaccinated, and avoid respiratory irritants

diseases.name: Endometriosis
diseases.causes: tissue similar to the lining inside the uterus grows outside it
diseases.treatment: pain relief medications, hormone therapy, surgery
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: no known prevention, but early diagnosis helps

diseases.name: Lyme disease
diseases.causes: bacterial infection transmitted through tick bites
diseases.cure: curable with early treatment
diseases.prevention: avoid tick bites, wear protective clothing

diseases.name: Chronic fatigue syndrome
diseases.causes: unknown, but may involve viral infections or immune system issues
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: no known prevention, but early treatment can help

diseases.name: Lupus
diseases.causes: immune system attacking healthy tissue
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed

diseases.name: Cystic fibrosis
diseases.causes: mutation in the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator gene
diseases.cure: no cure, but treatment can improve quality of life

diseases.name: Sickle cell disease
diseases.causes: abnormal hemoglobin causing red blood cells to deform
diseases.cure: bone marrow transplant can be curative in some cases

diseases.name: Addison's disease
diseases.causes: adrenal glands producing insufficient hormones
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable with treatment
diseases.prevention: no known prevention, but early diagnosis helps

diseases.name: Pneumoconiosis
diseases.causes: inhalation of dust, often in occupational settings
diseases.cure: no cure, but progression can be slowed
diseases.prevention: using protective equipment in dusty environments

diseases.name: Thrombocytopenia
diseases.causes: low platelet count due to various factors
diseases.cure: depends on the cause, some are curable
diseases.prevention: no known prevention for all cases

diseases.name: Thyroid disorders
diseases.causes: dysfunction of the thyroid gland
diseases.cure: depends on the disorder, often manageable

diseases.name: Melanoma
diseases.causes: overexposure to ultraviolet (uv) light, genetic factors
diseases.cure: treatable, especially when caught early

diseases.name: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (copd)
diseases.causes: long-term exposure to irritants like smoke
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: avoid smoking and other lung irritants

diseases.name: Ankylosing spondylitis
diseases.causes: inflammatory disease affecting the spine and joints
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed
diseases.prevention: no known prevention, but early diagnosis helps

diseases.name: Charcot-marie-tooth disease
diseases.causes: inherited genetic mutations affecting peripheral nerves
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed

diseases.name: Creutzfeldt-jakob disease
diseases.causes: prion disease leading to brain degeneration
diseases.treatment: no effective treatment, supportive care only
diseases.cure: no cure

diseases.name: Kawasaki disease
diseases.causes: unknown, possibly related to immune response
diseases.cure: generally treatable, but can lead to complications

diseases.name: Bipolar disorder
diseases.causes: genetic and environmental factors
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable with treatment

diseases.name: Celiac disease
diseases.causes: autoimmune reaction to gluten
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable with diet

diseases.name: Gerd (gastroesophageal reflux disease)
diseases.causes: malfunction of the lower esophageal sphincter
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable
diseases.prevention: avoiding trigger foods and maintaining a healthy weight

diseases.name: Pelvic inflammatory disease
diseases.causes: infection of the female reproductive organs
diseases.cure: treatable, but complications can occur
diseases.prevention: safe sex practices and regular check-ups

diseases.name: Sickle cell disease
diseases.causes: genetic mutation affecting hemoglobin
diseases.cure: bone marrow transplant can cure some cases

diseases.name: Chronic fatigue syndrome
diseases.causes: unknown, possibly related to viral infections or stress
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Endometriosis
diseases.causes: growth of endometrial tissue outside the uterus
diseases.treatment: pain relief medications, hormonal therapies, surgery
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable with treatment

diseases.name: Huntington's disease
diseases.causes: genetic mutation leading to nerve cell degeneration
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed

diseases.name: Otitis media
diseases.causes: bacterial or viral infection of the middle ear
diseases.cure: usually resolves with treatment
diseases.prevention: good hygiene, avoiding exposure to smoke

diseases.name: Pneumonia
diseases.causes: infection by bacteria, viruses, or fungi
diseases.treatment: antibiotics for bacterial pneumonia, supportive care
diseases.cure: usually treatable with proper care

diseases.name: Irritable bowel syndrome (ibs)
diseases.causes: unknown, but may involve gut-brain interaction
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Schizophrenia
diseases.causes: combination of genetic, brain chemistry, and environmental factors
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable with treatment

diseases.name: Rheumatoid arthritis
diseases.causes: autoimmune disorder affecting joints
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed

diseases.name: Epilepsy
diseases.causes: variety of factors, including genetics and brain injury
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable with treatment

diseases.name: Hepatitis c
diseases.causes: infection with hepatitis c virus
diseases.cure: most people can be cured with treatment
diseases.prevention: avoiding sharing needles and safe sex practices

diseases.name: Hashimoto's thyroiditis
diseases.causes: autoimmune attack on the thyroid gland
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable with treatment

diseases.name: Migraines
diseases.causes: various triggers, including hormonal changes and stress
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Asthma
diseases.causes: inflammation of airways, often triggered by allergens
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Glaucoma
diseases.causes: damage to the optic nerve, often related to high eye pressure
diseases.cure: no cure, but progression can be managed
diseases.prevention: regular eye exams and managing risk factors

diseases.name: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (copd)
diseases.causes: long-term exposure to irritants, primarily smoking
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable with treatment

diseases.name: Anxiety disorders
diseases.causes: genetic, environmental, and psychological factors
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Alcohol use disorder
diseases.causes: combination of genetic and environmental factors
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable
diseases.prevention: awareness and education about alcohol use

diseases.name: Psoriasis
diseases.causes: autoimmune response leading to skin cell overproduction
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Tuberculosis
diseases.causes: infection with mycobacterium tuberculosis
diseases.cure: can be cured with appropriate treatment

diseases.name: Parkinson's disease
diseases.causes: loss of dopamine-producing neurons in the brain
diseases.treatment: medications to manage symptoms, physical therapy
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed

diseases.name: Diabetes type 2
diseases.causes: insulin resistance and eventual insulin deficiency
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable with lifestyle changes

diseases.name: Sickle cell disease
diseases.causes: mutation in the hemoglobin gene
diseases.cure: possible with bone marrow transplant

diseases.name: Diverticulitis
diseases.causes: inflammation of diverticula in the colon
diseases.treatment: dietary changes, antibiotics, surgery in severe cases
diseases.cure: no definitive cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Gout
diseases.causes: buildup of uric acid crystals in joints
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable with treatment

diseases.name: Thyroid cancer
symptoms: pain in the neck or throat
diseases.causes: genetic mutations and exposure to radiation
diseases.cure: often curable if caught early

diseases.name: Chronic fatigue syndrome
diseases.causes: unknown, may involve immune system dysfunction
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Alzheimer's disease
diseases.causes: complex interactions of genetic, lifestyle, and environmental factors
diseases.treatment: medications to manage symptoms, supportive care
diseases.cure: no cure, but treatments can slow progression

diseases.name: Frontotemporal dementia
diseases.causes: degeneration of nerve cells in the frontal and temporal lobes
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable with treatment

diseases.name: Chronic sinusitis
diseases.causes: inflammation of the sinuses, often due to infections or allergies
diseases.treatment: nasal corticosteroids, saline nasal irrigation, antibiotics if bacterial
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Restless legs syndrome
diseases.causes: often unknown, may be related to iron deficiency
diseases.treatment: lifestyle changes, medications, treating underlying conditions
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Chronic pancreatitis
diseases.causes: long-term inflammation of the pancreas
diseases.treatment: pain management, dietary changes, surgery in severe cases
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable
diseases.prevention: avoiding alcohol and managing underlying conditions

diseases.name: Myasthenia gravis
diseases.causes: immune system attacks communication between nerves and muscles
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed

diseases.name: Osteoarthritis
diseases.causes: wear and tear of cartilage in joints
diseases.treatment: pain relievers, physical therapy, joint replacement in severe cases
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable
diseases.prevention: maintaining a healthy weight, regular exercise

diseases.name: Psoriasis
diseases.causes: autoimmune response leading to rapid skin cell growth
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Neurofibromatosis
diseases.causes: genetic mutations
diseases.treatment: monitoring, surgery for tumors, management of symptoms
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Tuberculosis
diseases.causes: infection with mycobacterium tuberculosis bacteria
diseases.cure: often curable with proper treatment

diseases.name: Migraines
diseases.causes: various triggers, including hormonal changes, stress, and certain foods
diseases.treatment: pain relief medications, lifestyle changes, preventive medications
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Meningitis
diseases.type: infection of the protective membranes covering the brain
diseases.causes: viral, bacterial, or fungal infections
diseases.treatment: antibiotics for bacterial meningitis, supportive care
diseases.cure: varies by type, but many can be treatable

diseases.name: Polycystic ovary syndrome (pcos)
diseases.causes: hormonal imbalance
diseases.cure: no cure, but manageable

diseases.name: Meningococcal disease
diseases.causes: infection with neisseria meningitidis
diseases.cure: treatable if caught early

diseases.name: Sickle cell anemia
diseases.causes: inherited mutation in hemoglobin
diseases.treatment: pain relief, blood transfusions, bone marrow transplant
diseases.cure: no cure, but treatments can manage symptoms

diseases.name: Cystitis
diseases.causes: bacterial infection
diseases.cure: typically curable with treatment

diseases.name: Cervical spondylosis
diseases.causes: wear and tear of cervical spine
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed

diseases.name: Hives
diseases.causes: allergies, stress, infections
diseases.cure: usually resolves on its own

diseases.name: Chronic fatigue syndrome (cfs)
diseases.causes: unknown, possibly viral infections or immune dysfunction
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed

diseases.name: Achalasia
diseases.causes: nerve damage to esophagus
diseases.cure: treatable but no complete cure

diseases.name: Sarcoidosis
diseases.causes: immune system overreaction
diseases.cure: not curable, but manageable

diseases.name: Trigeminal neuralgia
diseases.causes: pressure on the trigeminal nerve
diseases.cure: treatable, often manageable

diseases.name: Raynaud's disease
diseases.causes: narrowing of blood vessels in response to cold or stress
diseases.cure: manageable, not curable

diseases.name: Guillain-barré syndrome
diseases.causes: immune system attacking peripheral nerves
diseases.cure: partial recovery in most cases

diseases.name: Barrett's esophagus
diseases.causes: chronic acid reflux
diseases.cure: manage symptoms, monitor for cancer development

diseases.name: Trichotillomania
diseases.causes: psychological stress, anxiety
diseases.cure: manageable with therapy

diseases.name: Herpes zoster (shingles)
diseases.causes: reactivation of varicella-zoster virus
diseases.cure: treatable, symptoms can be reduced

diseases.name: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (als)
diseases.causes: degeneration of motor neurons
diseases.cure: not curable

diseases.name: Sjogren's syndrome
diseases.causes: immune system attacking glands
diseases.cure: no cure, but symptoms can be managed

diseases.name: Peripheral neuropathy
diseases.causes: damage to peripheral nerves
diseases.cure: not curable, but symptoms can be managed

diseases.name: Marfan syndrome
diseases.causes: genetic mutation affecting connective tissue
diseases.cure: not curable, but treatable

diseases.name: Pityriasis rosea
diseases.causes: possibly viral infection
diseases.cure: self-limiting, resolves on its own

diseases.name: Thrombophlebitis
diseases.causes: blood clot in vein
diseases.cure: treatable, but prevention of recurrence is needed

diseases.name: Rosacea
diseases.causes: unknown, may involve genetic and environmental factors
diseases.cure: not curable, but manageable
diseases.prevention: avoid triggers like sun exposure, spicy food

diseases.name: Tennis elbow
diseases.causes: overuse of forearm muscles
diseases.cure: treatable with proper care
diseases.prevention: strengthen muscles, proper technique in activities

diseases.name: Polyarteritis nodosa
diseases.causes: unknown, possibly autoimmune
diseases.cure: not curable, but manageable

diseases.name: Malaria
diseases.causes: plasmodium parasite spread by mosquitoes
diseases.cure: treatable with proper medication
diseases.prevention: use of mosquito nets, insect repellent

diseases.name: Scleroderma
diseases.causes: immune system attacking connective tissue
diseases.cure: not curable, but manageable

diseases.name: Pemphigus vulgaris
diseases.causes: immune system attacking skin cells
diseases.cure: not curable, but treatable

diseases.name: Myocarditis
diseases.causes: viral infections, autoimmune diseases
diseases.cure: treatable but depends on the cause

diseases.name: Takayasu's arteritis
diseases.causes: autoimmune disorder
diseases.cure: not curable but manageable

diseases.name: Raynaud's disease
diseases.causes: vasospasm of arteries
diseases.cure: manageable but not curable

diseases.name: Gastroenteritis
diseases.causes: viral, bacterial, or parasitic infection
diseases.cure: self-limiting, resolves on its own
diseases.prevention: good hygiene, safe food and water

diseases.name: Bells palsy
diseases.causes: viral infections
diseases.cure: usually resolves on its own

diseases.name: Guillain-barre syndrome
diseases.causes: immune system attacking nerves
diseases.cure: not curable but treatable

diseases.name: Dermatomyositis
diseases.causes: autoimmune response
diseases.cure: not curable but manageable

diseases.name: Trypanosomiasis (sleeping sickness)
diseases.causes: tsetse fly bite
diseases.cure: curable with treatment

diseases.name: Pemphigoid
diseases.causes: immune system attacking skin layers
diseases.cure: not curable but manageable

diseases.name: Sialolithiasis
diseases.causes: salivary gland stones
diseases.cure: curable with treatment

diseases.name: Buerger's disease
diseases.causes: smoking-related inflammation of blood vessels
diseases.cure: not curable but manageable

diseases.name: Chagas disease
diseases.causes: trypanosoma cruzi parasite
diseases.cure: curable in acute phase
diseases.prevention: avoid insect bites, improve housing conditions

diseases.name: Henoch-schonlein purpura
diseases.causes: autoimmune response, often following an infection
diseases.cure: usually self-limiting but can require treatment

diseases.name: Pityriasis alba
diseases.causes: unknown, possibly related to eczema
diseases.cure: manageable but may persist for years

diseases.name: Lymphangioleiomyomatosis
diseases.causes: abnormal muscle cell growth in lungs
diseases.cure: not curable but treatable

diseases.name: Polymyalgia rheumatica
diseases.causes: unknown, possibly autoimmune
diseases.cure: manageable but not curable

diseases.name: Erythema multiforme
diseases.causes: often triggered by infections or medications
diseases.cure: resolves on its own but can recur

diseases.name: Klinefelter syndrome
diseases.causes: extra x chromosome in males
diseases.cure: not curable

diseases.name: Polycythemia vera
diseases.causes: bone marrow producing too many red blood cells
diseases.cure: not curable but manageable

diseases.name: Molluscum contagiosum
diseases.causes: molluscum contagiosum virus
diseases.treatment: usually self-limiting, medications for severe cases
diseases.cure: curable but can persist for months
diseases.prevention: good hygiene, avoid skin contact with infected

diseases.name: Pseudogout
diseases.causes: calcium pyrophosphate crystal buildup in joints
diseases.cure: not curable but manageable

diseases.name: Nephrotic syndrome
symptoms: weight gain due to fluid retention
diseases.causes: damage to blood vessels in kidneys
diseases.cure: manageable but not always curable

diseases.name: Vasculitis
diseases.causes: immune system attacks blood vessels
diseases.cure: manageable, varies by type

diseases.name: Medullary sponge kidney
diseases.causes: genetic mutation affecting kidney development
diseases.cure: not curable

diseases.name: Interstitial cystitis
diseases.causes: unknown, possibly related to bladder inflammation
diseases.cure: manageable but chronic

diseases.name: Gilbert's syndrome
diseases.causes: genetic mutation affecting bilirubin processing
diseases.cure: not needed as it is usually harmless

diseases.name: Morphea
diseases.causes: autoimmune-related inflammation
diseases.cure: self-limiting but can recur

diseases.name: Gastroparesis
diseases.causes: delayed stomach emptying due to nerve damage
diseases.cure: manageable but not curable

diseases.name: Sweet syndrome
diseases.causes: unknown, possibly linked to infections or autoimmune responses
diseases.cure: manageable, may recur

diseases.name: Ramsay hunt syndrome
diseases.causes: varicella-zoster virus reactivation
diseases.cure: treatable, but some symptoms may persist

diseases.causes: calcium pyrophosphate crystal buildup in joints
diseases.cure: not curable but manageable

diseases.cure: manageable but not curable

diseases.cure: manageable, may recur

diseases.causes: varicella-zoster virus reactivation

diseases.name: Achondroplasia
diseases.causes: mutation in FGFR3 gene
diseases.cure: not curable

diseases.name: Prader-willi syndrome
diseases.causes: loss of function of certain genes on chromosome 15
diseases.cure: not curable

diseases.name: Erysipelas
diseases.causes: bacterial infection by group A streptococcus
diseases.cure: curable with treatment

diseases.name: Hereditary angioedema
diseases.causes: mutation affecting C1 inhibitor protein
diseases.cure: manageable but not curable

diseases.name: Gilbert's syndrome
diseases.causes: genetic mutation affecting bilirubin processing
diseases.cure: not necessary as it’s usually harmless

diseases.name: Ataxia-telangiectasia
diseases.causes: genetic mutations in ATM gene
diseases.cure: not curable

diseases.name: Granulomatosis with polyangiitis
diseases.causes: immune system attacks blood vessels
diseases.cure: manageable, may go into remission

diseases.name: Fabry disease
diseases.causes: mutation in GLA gene leading to enzyme deficiency
diseases.cure: manageable but not curable

diseases.name: Moyamoya disease
diseases.causes: narrowing of arteries in the brain
diseases.cure: not curable but manageable

diseases.name: Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency
diseases.causes: mutation in SERPINA1 gene leading to enzyme deficiency
diseases.cure: manageable but not curable

diseases.name: Measles
symptoms: white spots inside the mouth (koplik spots)
red rash that starts on the face and spreads downward
diseases.causes: Caused by the measles virus, typically spread through respiratory droplets from coughing and sneezing.

supportive_care: Fever reducers like acetaminophen or ibuprofen
other_treatments: Antibiotics for secondary bacterial infections if present

diseases.cure: There is no specific cure for measles. The virus must run its course, but symptoms can be managed with supportive care.

prevention.vaccination: Measles, Mumps, and Rubella (MMR) vaccine is the most effective form of prevention.
others: Practicing good hygiene, like frequent handwashing

diseases.name: Rabies
diseases.causes: Rabies is caused by the rabies virus, which is primarily transmitted through the saliva of infected animals via bites or scratches. Common carriers include dogs, bats, raccoons, foxes, and skunks.

supportive_care: Sedatives and muscle relaxants for agitation and spasms in advanced cases
procedures: Post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) which includes vaccination and immune globulin

diseases.cure: Once symptoms appear, rabies is almost always fatal. Early treatment with post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) can prevent the virus from progressing if administered promptly after exposure.

prevention.vaccination: Rabies vaccination is available for both pre-exposure (for those at risk) and post-exposure prevention.
lifestyle_measures: Avoid contact with wild animals, especially in regions where rabies is prevalent
Seek immediate medical attention after any animal bite or scratch

diseases.name: Tetanus
diseases.causes: Caused by the Clostridium tetani bacteria, which enters the body through cuts or wounds, typically from rusty nails or contaminated objects.
diseases.cure: There is no cure for tetanus once symptoms start, but supportive treatment can reduce severity. Recovery may take weeks to months.

prevention.vaccination: Tetanus vaccine (often part of the DTaP/Tdap series) is the most effective prevention.
lifestyle_measures: Prompt medical attention for deep or dirty wounds

diseases.name: Leprosy
symptoms: numbness in hands, arms, feet, and legs
diseases.causes: Caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium leprae, spread through respiratory droplets or close contact with an untreated infected person.
diseases.cure: Leprosy is curable with a multi-drug therapy (MDT) regimen that lasts for 6-12 months.

prevention.vaccination: No specific vaccine; BCG vaccine offers some protection.
lifestyle_measures: Avoid prolonged contact with untreated patients.

diseases.name: Zika virus
diseases.causes: Caused by the Zika virus, primarily transmitted through mosquito bites (Aedes species), and can be transmitted sexually or from mother to child.
diseases.cure: No specific cure; treatment focuses on symptom relief.

diseases.name: Diphtheria
symptoms: thick gray coating in the throat
diseases.causes: Caused by the bacterium Corynebacterium diphtheriae, spread through respiratory droplets.
diseases.cure: Treatment with antitoxin and antibiotics can cure diphtheria if caught early.

prevention.vaccination: Diphtheria vaccine (part of DTaP or Tdap).

diseases.name: Plague (bubonic)
diseases.causes: Caused by the bacterium Yersinia pestis, typically transmitted through the bite of an infected flea or contact with contaminated fluids.
diseases.cure: Bubonic plague is treatable with antibiotics if administered early.

lifestyle_measures: Avoid contact with wild rodents and their fleas

diseases.name: Rubella (german measles)
diseases.causes: Caused by the rubella virus, spread through respiratory droplets or from mother to fetus during pregnancy.
diseases.cure: There is no specific cure, but symptoms usually resolve on their own.

diseases.name: Mumps
diseases.causes: Caused by the mumps virus, spread through respiratory droplets or direct contact with an infected person.
diseases.cure: No specific cure, but the virus typically resolves on its own.

diseases.name: Scarlet fever
diseases.causes: Caused by a toxin produced by Group A Streptococcus bacteria, spread through respiratory droplets.
diseases.cure: Scarlet fever is curable with antibiotics.

diseases.name: Yellow fever
diseases.causes: Caused by the yellow fever virus, transmitted through the bite of infected mosquitoes.
diseases.cure: No specific cure; supportive treatment can help manage symptoms.

lifestyle_measures: Avoid areas with yellow fever outbreaks

diseases.name: Smallpox
symptoms: rash that develops into pus-filled sores
diseases.causes: Caused by the variola virus, spread through direct contact with an infected person or contaminated objects.
diseases.cure: Smallpox has been eradicated, but there is no specific cure. Vaccination was the primary means of prevention.

prevention.vaccination: Smallpox vaccine (no longer administered as the disease has been eradicated).

diseases.name: Cholera
diseases.causes: Caused by the bacterium Vibrio cholerae, typically spread through contaminated water or food.
diseases.cure: Cholera is curable with prompt treatment and rehydration.

diseases.name: Syphilis
diseases.causes: Caused by the bacterium Treponema pallidum, primarily spread through sexual contact with an infected person. It can also be passed from mother to baby during pregnancy (congenital syphilis).

medications: Alternative antibiotics (Doxycycline or Tetracycline for those allergic to penicillin)
supportive_care: Follow-up blood tests to monitor treatment success
Avoid sexual contact until fully treated

diseases.cure: Syphilis can be cured with appropriate antibiotics, particularly in the early stages. However, damage from the late stages (tertiary syphilis) may be irreversible.

prevention.vaccination: No vaccine is available for syphilis.
lifestyle_measures: Avoid sexual contact with infected individuals
